channel.title: Kevon Davenport's Github Site
channel.description: Recent content on Kevon Davenport's Github Site

item.title: Is Jonathan Taylor a runner to watch?
item.description: Former Wisconsin Running Back Jonathan Taylor was a monster in college. Averaging over 2,000 yards a season, Taylor was a large contributor to Wisconsin’s successful offense. The NFL was no different for Mr. Taylor. His Indianapolis Colt’s had a promising 11-5 season that I’m sure Jonathan played a major roll in. Let’s look at some statistics! library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ────────────────── ## ✓ ggplot2 3.3.2 ✓ purrr 0.3.4 ## ✓ tibble 3.

item.title: Is Jonathan Taylor the RB of the future?
item.description: Former Wisconsin Running Back Jonathan Taylor was a monster in college. Averaging over 2,000 yards a season, Taylor was a large contributor to Wisconsin’s successful offense. The NFL was no different for Mr. Taylor. His Indianapolis Colt’s had a promising 11-5 season that I’m sure Jonathan played a major roll in. Let’s look at some statistics! library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.0 ── ## ✓ ggplot2 3.3.2 ✓ purrr 0.

item.title: Text Cleaning
item.description: Loading the tidyverse and ggalt library into my notebook. library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ────────────────── ## ✓ ggplot2 3.3.2 ✓ purrr 0.3.4 ## ✓ tibble 3.0.3 ✓ dplyr 1.0.2 ## ✓ tidyr 1.1.2 ✓ stringr 1.4.0 ## ✓ readr 1.3.1 ✓ forcats 0.5.0 ## ── Conflicts ── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ## x dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## x dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() library(ggalt) ## Registered S3 methods overwritten by 'ggalt': ## method from ## grid.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.

item.title: A Plain Markdown Post
item.description: This is a post written in plain Markdown (*.md) instead of R Markdown (*.Rmd). The major differences are: You cannot run any R code in a plain Markdown document, whereas in an R Markdown document, you can embed R code chunks (```{r}); A plain Markdown post is rendered through Blackfriday, and an R Markdown document is compiled by rmarkdown and Pandoc. There are many differences in syntax between Blackfriday’s Markdown and Pandoc’s Markdown.

item.title: About Kevon Davenport
item.description: I am Kevon Davenport from Pontiac, Michigan. I am a Sophomore at the University of Nebraska-Lincoln. I am also a wrestler at 157lbs for the Huskers.

item.title: R Notebook
item.description: This is an R Markdown Notebook. When you execute code within the notebook, the results appear beneath the code. Try executing this chunk by clicking the Run button within the chunk or by placing your cursor inside it and pressing Cmd+Shift+Enter. plot(cars) Add a new chunk by clicking the Insert Chunk button on the toolbar or by pressing Cmd+Option+I. When you save the notebook, an HTML file containing the code and output will be saved alongside it (click the Preview button or press Cmd+Shift+K to preview the HTML file).
